code: @Manual{,   title = {compareDFx: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel},   author = {Stephen Knapp},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/skgithub14/compareDFx, https://skgithub14.github.io/compareDFx/}, }

what: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel
title: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel
text: {compareDFx} compares two data frames detailed reporting natively R MS Excel. comparison analysis shows changes errors row column provides summary statistics. {compareDFx} can also compare data frames different columns column classes. MS Excel report multi-tab workbook color codes additions, deletions, changes ideal R users non-R users alike.

title: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel
text: can install development version {compareDFx} like :

title: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel
text: Using two example data frames included package, df1 df2, walk {compareDFx} workflow. Next, need identify columns collectively make unique ID row, can run comparison. output get_comparison() list elements: See get_comparison() documentation details list element. view important ones. Summary statistics provided $row_summary, $col_summary_simple, $col_summary_by_col. $shows compared data df1 df2. data frame shown contains special columns provide information comparison record: source: whether data row came df1 df2 discrepancy: comparison status, can take one following values: "matched": row exactly matched df1 df2 (matched rows, df1 copy shown) "addition": row existed df1 "deletion": row existed df2 "changed": row id_cols matched df1 df2 least one column change "exact duplicate": row multiple occurrences either df1 df2. “Exact” means every value row matched perfectly duplicate copies. Exact duplicates can also marked "matched", "addition", "deletion", "changed". "ID duplicate (exact duplicate)": row multiple occurrences combination id_cols either df1 df2 exact duplicate (meaning least one non-ID value row different). ID duplicate marked "matched", "addition", "deletion", "changed" multiple value matches comparing df1 df2. user fix errors re-run comparison. "ID contains NA": row either df1 df2 NA value one id_cols. comparison procedure requires non-NA values id_cols therefore rows marked "matched", "addition", "deletion", "changed". user fix errors re-run comparison. change group: discrepancy contains "changed" column populated arbitrary number links changed records df1 df2 exact dup cnt: discrepancy contains "exact duplicate" column give number exact duplicates df1 df2 ID dup cnt: discrepancy contains "ID duplicate (exact duplicate)" column gives number ID duplicates df1 df2 Finally, can produce multi-tab, color-coded MS Excel report comparison using create_comparison_excel(): Screen shot ‘’ tab comparison_report.xlsx Download comparison_report.xlsx
code: library(compareDFx)  # example data, df1  knitr::kable(compareDFx::df1) # example data, df2 knitr::kable(compareDFx::df2) id_cols <- c("id1", "id2") comparison <- get_comparison(df1, df2, id_cols) names(comparison) #>  [1] "col_summary_simple"     "col_summary_by_col"     "row_summary"            #>  [4] "all"                    "all_index_by_col"       "matched"                #>  [7] "adds"                   "dels"                   "changed"                #> [10] "change_index_by_col"    "changed_lr"             "change_index_by_col_lr" #> [13] "exact_dups"             "id_dups"                "id_NA"                  #> [16] "df1"                    "df2"                    "id_cols"                #> [19] "cc_out" knitr::kable(comparison$row_summary) knitr::kable(comparison$col_summary_simple) knitr::kable(comparison$col_summary_by_col) knitr::kable(comparison$all) dir <- system.file("extdata", package = "compareDFx") create_comparison_excel(comparison,                          path = file.path(dir, "comparison_report.xlsx"),                         autoOpen = TRUE) #> [1] 0

what: compareDFx: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel — compareDFx-package
title: compareDFx: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel — compareDFx-package
text: Compares two data frames detailed reporting. report can analyzed natively R MS Excel. comparison analysis shows changes errors row column provides summary statistics. compareDFx can also compare data frames different columns column classes. MS Excel report multi-tab workbook color codes additions, deletions, changes can easily used non-R users.

title: compareDFx: Compare Data Frame Versions in R and MS Excel — compareDFx-package

what: Separate duplicated data frame rows from rows with no duplicates — find_dups
title: Separate duplicated data frame rows from rows with no duplicates — find_dups
text: Separates data frame sub-data frames based types row duplication lack thereof. Also identifies NA values id_cols.

title: Separate duplicated data frame rows from rows with no duplicates — find_dups
Separate duplicated data frame rows from rows with no duplicates — find_dups
text: df data frame without duplicated rows id_cols character vector column names form unique ID source string, name data source (usually "df1" "df2")

title: Separate duplicated data frame rows from rows with no duplicates — find_dups
text: names list four elements: exact_dups: rows duplicated every value, one distinct row exact_dups case column n list many occurences row df. id_dups: rows duplicated based id_cols values differed, column n contains many ID duplicates one ID exist df id_NA: rows NA value id_cols column no_dups: df id_dups row removed one copy exact_dups row.

title: Compare two data frames — get_comparison
text: Generates detailed comparison report two data frames

title: Compare two data frames — get_comparison
Compare two data frames — get_comparison
text: df1, df2 data frames compare id_cols column names df1 df2 make unique ID tolerance amount two numbers can differ considered equal, default 0.00001

title: Compare two data frames — get_comparison
text: named list elements: col_summary_simple: high level summary statistics columns, data frame col_summary_by_col: comparison summary statistics column name, data frame row_summary: comparison summary statistics row, data frame : data frame data df1 df2 all_index_by_col: list row indices column df1 df2 different values matched: data frame rows df1 df2 match exactly adds: data frame additions df1 dels: data frame deletions df2 changed: data frame compares df1 df2 changed rows, top-bottom view change_index_by_col: list row indices column changed df1 df2 different values changed_lr: data frame compares df1 df2 changed rows, left-right view change_index_by_col_lr: list row indices column changed_lr df1 df2 different values exact_dups: data frame lists rows exact duplicates , df1 df2 id_dups: data frame lists rows duplicated ID column values (meaning IDs unique df1 df2) exact duplicates (least one non-ID column different duplicate row) id_NA: data frame rows NA ID values df1 df2 df1: original df1 data frame df2: original df2 data frame id_cols: vector column names collectively make unique row ID cc_out: list output compare_cols() details columns df1 df2 common columns common

what: Force two data frames to have the same columns by creating dummy columns — insert_dummy_cols
title: Force two data frames to have the same columns by creating dummy columns — insert_dummy_cols
text: column data frame 1 missing data frame 2, function creates missing column data frame 2 fills NA, vice-version. also makes classes dummy columns match ensure data frames column order.

title: Force two data frames to have the same columns by creating dummy columns — insert_dummy_cols
Force two data frames to have the same columns by creating dummy columns — insert_dummy_cols
text: df1, df2 data frames compare cc_out list output compare_cols() id_cols character vector id columns output compare_cols()

title: Force two data frames to have the same columns by creating dummy columns — insert_dummy_cols
text: named list two elements: df1: modified df1 data frame df2: modified df2 data frame

title: Standardize column order — standardize_col_order
text: Puts columns two data frames order places unique identifiers columns far left data frame. Data frames must exact columns (, apply insert_dummy_cols() first)

Standardize column order — standardize_col_order
text: df1, df2 data frames compare id_cols character vector id columns output compare_cols()

what: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by columns — summarize_compare_cols
title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by columns — summarize_compare_cols
text: Creates two data frames summarize differences columns two versions data frame. first provides higher level summary statistics number columns data frame, number columns changes, number columns name different classes. second data frame lists column number changes, whether column included new /old data frame, original column class.

title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by columns — summarize_compare_cols
code: summarize_compare_cols(   df1,   df2,   id_cols,   cc_out,   df_standard_cols,   comparison_table_diff )

title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by columns — summarize_compare_cols
text: df1, df2 data frames compare id_cols character vector id columns output compare_cols() cc_out list output compare_cols() df_standard_cols list returned standardize_col_order() comparison_table_diff comparison_table_diff list element compare_df_wrapper() output.

title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by columns — summarize_compare_cols
text: named list containing two data frames: report_simple data frame higher level summary statistics report_by_col data frame lists summary statistics column name

what: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by rows — summarize_compare_rows
title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by rows — summarize_compare_rows
text: Produces table high level summary statistics comparing two data frames terms rows

title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by rows — summarize_compare_rows
code: summarize_compare_rows(   df1,   df2,   adds,   dels,   changed_lr,   matched,   exact_dups,   id_dups,   id_NA,   id_cols )

title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by rows — summarize_compare_rows
text: df1, df2 data frames compare adds data frame additions df1 dels data frame deletions (df2 df1) changed_lr data frame changes left/right layout one row per change, two matched data frame unchanged rows duplicates removed exact_dups exact_dups list element returned segregate_compare() id_dups id_dups list element returned segregate_compare() id_NA id_NA list element returned segregate_compare() id_cols character vector id columns output compare_cols()

title: Summary metrics for data frame comparison by rows — summarize_compare_rows
text: data frame three columns: Rows, df1 data, df2 data
